channel.title: CVE Feed for wcmp -- MultiVendorX – The Ultimate WooCommerce Multivendor Marketplace Solution
channel.description: The latest CVEs for wcmp -- MultiVendorX – The Ultimate WooCommerce Multivendor Marketplace Solution

item.title: CVE-2024-9943|2024-10-24T07:35:57.226Z -- wcmp -- multivendorx%20%E2%80%93%20the%20ultimate%20woocommerce%20multivendor%20marketplace%20solution
item.description: The MultiVendorX – The Ultimate WooCommerce Multivendor Marketplace Solution plugin for WordPress is vulnerable to Cross-Site Request Forgery in all versions up to, and including, 4.2.4. This is due to missing or incorrect nonce validation on several functions in api/class-mvx-rest-controller.php. This makes it possible for unauthenticated attackers to update vendor account details, create vendor accounts, and delete arbitrary users via a forged request granted they can trick a site administrator into performing an action such as clicking on a link.

item.title: CVE-2024-9531|2024-10-24T07:35:55.646Z -- wcmp -- multivendorx%20%E2%80%93%20the%20ultimate%20woocommerce%20multivendor%20marketplace%20solution
item.description: The MultiVendorX – The Ultimate WooCommerce Multivendor Marketplace Solution plugin for WordPress is vulnerable to unauthorized modification of data due to a missing capability check on the 'mvx_sent_deactivation_request' function in all versions up to, and including, 4.2.4. This makes it possible for authenticated attackers, with Subscriber-level access and above, to send a canned email to the site's administrator asking to delete the profile of an arbitrary vendor.

item.title: CVE-2024-8289|2024-09-04T08:30:38.531Z -- wcmp -- multivendorx%20%E2%80%93%20the%20ultimate%20woocommerce%20multivendor%20marketplace%20solution
item.description: The MultiVendorX – The Ultimate WooCommerce Multivendor Marketplace Solution plugin for WordPress is vulnerable to privilege escalation/de-escalation and account takeover due to an insufficient capability check on the update_item_permissions_check and create_item_permissions_check functions in all versions up to, and including, 4.2.0. This makes it possible for unauthenticated attackers to change the password of any user with the vendor role, create new users with the vendor role, and demote other users like administrators to the vendor role.

item.title: CVE-2024-8289|2024-09-04T14:08:02.811Z -- wcmp -- multivendorx%20%E2%80%93%20the%20ultimate%20woocommerce%20multivendor%20marketplace%20solution
item.description: The MultiVendorX – The Ultimate WooCommerce Multivendor Marketplace Solution plugin for WordPress is vulnerable to privilege escalation/de-escalation and account takeover due to an insufficient capability check on the update_item_permissions_check and create_item_permissions_check functions in all versions up to, and including, 4.2.0. This makes it possible for unauthenticated attackers to change the password of any user with the vendor role, create new users with the vendor role, and demote other users like administrators to the vendor role.
